longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports issued to nationals of the Netherlands must be
  valid on arrival. 

Visa required, except for Nationals of the Netherlands born in
Aruba, Bonaire, Curacao, Saba, St. Eustatius or St. Maarten.
Visa required, except for Nationals of the Netherlands born
outside Aruba, Bonaire, Curacao, Saba, St. Eustatius or St.
Maarten for a max. stay of 6 months (extension of additional 6
months possible). 
Minors:
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of Netherlands will be expected
  to hold their own passport or National ID Card (where
  applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus,
  Romania or a Schengen Member State . 
- Unaccompanied minors under 18 years of age must
  
- Minors under 18 years of age accompanied by parents with a
  different surname  
Additional Information:
- On 10 October 2010, the Netherlands Antilles have been
  dissolved. Curacao continues as an independent country
  within the Kingdom of the Netherlands. 
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to
  cover their stay and documents required for their next
  destination. 
Warning:
- Visitors not holding return/onward ticket could be refused
  entry
